ratingGuide.guidance: Visa approval takes >12 months or is unpredictable.
No active AAA studios; legacy presence only.
Quarterly in-person game-dev events (~0.25 per month).

No game-dev events or community activity.
<= USD 0.80M yearly burn; maximizes runway for an unfunded studio.
> USD 1.40M yearly burn; unsustainable for our profile.
<= USD 25k per year for 10-person office space.
Visa processing >28 weeks with unpredictable steps.
No viable visa path or indefinite timelines.

Net daycare tuition for a 1-year-old <=EUR/USD 500 per month for a non resident child.
Net daycare tuition for a 1-year-old <=EUR/USD 350 per month for a permanent resident child.

Family healthcare costs (premiums plus typical out-of-pocket) <=EUR/USD 1,000 per month for non residents.
>EUR/USD 3,200 per month or highly volatile billing.
Monthly costs <=EUR/USD 800 with permanent resident coverage.
Healthcare access is not tied to employment; universal coverage regardless of job status.
Minimal employment tie; leaving a job rarely affects coverage and public options are simple.
Limited employment tie; most residents keep coverage when changing jobs with little friction.
Some employment tie; coverage changes are uncommon but possible when job changes.
Moderate employment tie; a noticeable share lose or must change coverage when job changes.
Significant employment tie; many residents rely on employer plans, alternatives exist but are costly or complex.
Strong employment tie; losing a job typically forces a plan change and higher costs.
Very strong employment tie; job loss often causes coverage gaps without employer or expensive alternatives.
Employment-dominant model; most residents lose affordable coverage outside employer plans.
Healthcare is primarily tied to employment; leaving a job usually means losing affordable coverage.
